alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 19 at 7:32AM HST until July 19 at 9:15AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 815 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 AM HST, rain gages indicated amounts of half an inch to one inch per hour over the South Hilo and Puna Districts. Radar showed moderate rainfall over the Hamakua District and portions of the Kohala Mountains, with rates less than one inch per hour. Water levels in Honolii Stream and Wailuku River remain high but have started lowering. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Waikoloa Village, Kapaau, Honokaa, Pohakuloa Camp, Pohakuloa Training Area, Laupahoehoe, Honomu, Ninole, Papaikou, Ookala, Pepeekeo, Hakalau, Paauilo, Volcano, Glenwood, Mountain View and Keaau. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 815 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
